title: Understanding Schizophrenia Patients' Self-Awareness and Egocentric Learning Deficits Through Virtual Reality-Based Spatial Navigation Learning

context.prior_knowledge: Understanding of basic psychology, neuroscience, schizophrenia symptoms, and cognitive deficits; experience with VR technology
context.additional_context: Pre-service teachers analyze cognitive deficit mechanisms in schizophrenia patients using VR technology and learn how to apply these findings to education. Conducted through practical exercises using personal devices (BYOD) and group discussions

learning_goals: Learners can describe at least three neurophysiological mechanisms explaining self-awareness and egocentric learning deficits in schizophrenia patients.
Learners can practice analyzing patients' cognitive patterns through VR-based spatial navigation tasks and interpret the results.
Based on learned content, learners can propose at least two customized educational strategies for schizophrenia patients.
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
